events.name: DataScience SG Panel and Networking: "What makes a Data Scientist?"
events.description: Attention: Limited space at panel area (2nd floor) on a FIRST COME FIRST SERVED basis. Panel discussion will start at 7.00pm . Please change your RSVP if you're unable to attend. Thanks and see you soon! =D We'll be switching it up for this month's meetup with a more casual panel discussion. Three Data Science Leads/Data Scientists from Grabtaxi, Lazada, and Rakuten will be sharing on "What makes a Data Scientist?" with Koo moderating. Our meetup will be held at 1925, a brewery along Jalan Besar (~1km from Farrer Park or Lavender MRT). They have kindly offered to host, and extend the happy hour promotion to, us from 7-8pm. We will end the panel promptly at 7.45pm and carry on chatting over craft beers =). Given that spaces are limited, please only RSVP if you're able to arrive punctually (you can drop by after 7.45 without RSVP-ing). Thank you! Directions: From Lavender MRT, walk towards and down Lavender Street. Turn left at Jalan Besar Street and look for 1925, which has a yellow shop front. From Farrer Park MRT, walk towards and down Serangoon Rd before turning right at Lavender Street. Then, turn right on Jalan Besar and look for 1925, which has a yellow shop front. Here's how 1925 looks like. Take the stairs up to the 2nd floor. Agenda: • 6.45pm - 7.00pm: Come early to get a good seat! • 7.00pm - 7.45pm: Panel Discussion on "What makes a Data Scientist?" • 7.45pm - 9pm: Closing and Networking over beers. About the panelists: • Ewa Szymanska (Rakuten) About Ewa: Ewa is the Head of Consumer Behaviour Lab at Rakuten Asia. Ewa is responsible for leveraging consumer data and understanding of consumer behaviours to inform global marketing strategy, empower merchants, and develop solutions for targeted online advertising. Prior to joining Rakuten’s Global Marketing Office in Singapore, Ewa was a Behavioural Data Scientist at SingTel – Singapore Telecommunications – applying a psychographic approach to analysing location data for targeted mobile advertising. Ewa received her PhD in Experimental Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania. LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/ewa-eva-szymanska-phd/a/656/276 • Gergely Dányi (Grabtaxi) About Greg: Greg is currently a data scientist with GrabTaxi. (More to come...) LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/gergely-dányi/25/b43/6b7 ; • John Berns (Lazada) About John: John currently heads Lazada's Data Science team where he's involved in the ground-up implementation of data science & analytics capabilities, integrated data services and data platform for SE Asia's largest e-commerce company. LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jfxberns

events.name: July Meetup
events.description: Hi folks! We look forward to having you join us for our July meetup, on the 28th, 7.00pm at Paypal (They moved so please take note of the changes in the address). We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Anna, Winston or Guo Xiang) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips. See you on the 28th! Venue: PayPal Singapore office. 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 -------------- 1. "Beyond the MVC: An Object Taxonomy for Rails" by Ted Johansson / @drenmi 2. "Crystal Lang" by Grzegorz Witek @arnvald 3. "5 different approaches to testing a remote API" by John Wilkinson. @jcwilk * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! * Open Source Issues Hot Picks - This is a 5 minutes session where I'll (Guo Xiang) share open source issues that people can work on. -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com, or Guo Xiang @tgx_world or tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks: Venue:
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore

events.name: July Drupal meetup: Drupal hosting & infrastructure
events.description: This July, we're gonna talk about one of the most important piece that is hardly discussed: Drupal hosting and infrastructure. We are honoured to have representatives from Pantheon and Bootdev coming all the way down to Singapore to share with us about the science behind planning for your Drupal infrastructure for scalability and performance.

events.name: Let's meet up and get some feedback!
events.description: Thank you everybody for joining this meetup group! Let's have our very first meetup and get the ball rolling! Since this is the first time I'm conducting this meetup, I will propose the format of the meeting during the session and we'll iterate from there! (The spirit of testing right?) For this meetup just bring yourself and your game for others to test! If you have any survey forms you'd like us to fill out after we test out your game, please bring those too! You will be responsible for your own game running, so please bring all required equipment for your game to run to the meetup :D I can't wait to meet all of you!

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 13 & 14: Optimizing Application Delivery and Primer on Browser Networking Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Get ready for DevOpsDays!
events.description: We're delighted to bring you the first ever DevOpsDays to Singapore in October this year! In this meetup we would like to show you how DevOpsDays work, how you can contribute and make the best out of it. *DevOpsDays what?!* DevOpsDays is a 2-day unconference for DevOps-minded people like you that will be held in Singapore on October 16th and 17th, 2015. Date: October 16-17 2015 Location: Raffles City Convention Centre, Singapore Website: http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/ *Why so special ah?* DevOpsDays are not the typical tech conference you might know. DevOpsDays follow a quite unique format and in this meetup we'd like to introduce you the core concepts of DevOpsDays. DevOpsDays work best when you step out of your comfort zone and contribute by asking questions, suggesting ideas for open spaces, talk etc. It's what *you* make out of it and we want to provide you the best environment for sharing, open discussions and having fun with like-minded people from all over the world. A lot of attendees report that their first DevOpsDays has been a career-changing experience (examples: https://www.google.com/search?q=devopsdays+review ). We aim high and believe that we can make this the best DevOps event in Asia. For that we would love to hear your feedback, questions and ideas upfront. *Sounds good… I have a question!* Just add a comment below to ask us all the questions. *Agenda* 18:45 Start – grab some great food from the buffet and enjoy a drink with others 19:15 *Talk: What is DevOpsDays & How is it special?* 19:35 Break 19:50 *Talk: Help you prepare a talk and OpenSpace for DevOpsDays* 20:05 Break 20:15 *Talk / Fishbowl: DevOpsDays FAQ* 21:00 End Food and drinks will be served.

events.name: Reactive applications night
events.description: Reactive applications is the new norm of developing systems, do come for our next session to listen and discuss about this topics. We hope to see you at the next Singapore Spring User Group on 29th July 2015 @Paypal (5 Temasek Blvd #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore[masked]): 7.00PM : Beer & Pizzas 7.30PM : Talks Speaker: Sergi Almar Title: Realtime Web with Spring: SSE and WebSockets Abstract: Real-time has changed the way we interact with the web. Real-time applications mimic what we have in the real world, information as it happens being pushed to us. In this presentation you will learn how to build a more interactive and engaging user experience with Server-Sent Events and WebSockets. We will review the Spring Websocket architecture, the STOMP support, how to secure a WebSocket application and the new Spring 4.2 features. Speaker: Xavier Lepretre Title : Introduction to RxJava, with code examples Description : Functional Reactive Programming, and in particular its Java implementation, is well suited to applications that rely a lot on asynchronous calls and thread hopping. Discover the major coding elements of RxJava that will get you started. Non-developers may have their eyes glaze over by the 7th slide, though. Bio: Xavier has been coding on and off from the days of BASIC and Pascal, has used RxJava with Android at TradeHero for the past 7 months and did not look back.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: PyLadies SG July 2015 Meetup - Introduction to Python
events.description: Martin Brochhaus, one of PyCon SG's organizers, will join us and give a little presentation about how to install Python on Windows, OSX or Ubuntu. He will also show how to use the free editor Atom.io as a Python IDE and guide us through the first steps of writing a Python program.
events.location: PayPal office at 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 7, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985

events.name: Windows 10 Community Launch
events.description: RSVP Here: http://bit.ly/SWUGWin10Launch Windows 10 launch is just around the corner, in less 10 days if you’re counting. On July 29, Microsoft will make Windows 10 available, across 190 countries. The community leaders across various Singapore User Group are arranging for a Windows 10 Community Launch. In this launch, you will get to know what's new in Windows 10 and the things that matters to you most as an IT Professional and Developers. You are invited to join us for this new "Windows Update" and also meet up with the Singapore's MVPs. Please RSVP to help us with the logistic arrangement. Note: No confirmation email will be sent out upon registration. Just turn up on the actual day. Date : July 30, Thursday Time : 7.00pm - 10.00pm (Registration starts at 6.30pm) Venue : 1 Marina Boulevard, One Marina Boulevard, #21-01 Singapore[masked]
events.location: Microsoft Singpaore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorum, Singapore 018989

events.name: Python Meetup + PyCon SG 2016 Committee - July 2015
events.description: Hey everyone, we will be having a user meetup at the end of this July. In addition, we are looking for volunteers to help us make PyCon SG 2016 a reality. Come join us this evening to meet with the Python community in Singapore and be involved in our next conference! Venue: Red Hat 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore, Singapore Time: 7.30 - 9pm Agenda: - Martin Brochhaus: PyCon SG 2015 recap - Forming of PyCon SG 2016 Committee
events.location: Red Hat, 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore

events.name: Amateur Radio July Meetup
events.description: Amateur Radio, or Ham Radio, is a hobby with activities involving communication via radio waves. Most enthusiasts are fascinated with operating radio transmitters, receivers and antennas or how radio waves are able to get from one corner of the earth to another.
events.location: Alumni Medical Centre, No.2 College Road, Singapore 169850

events.name: Windows 10 Game Development
events.description: We are merging a Windows Launch event with this. Updated Agenda Please Register Here http://bit.ly/SWUGWin10Launch 6.30pm - Registration 7.00pm - What's new in Windows 10 (Auditorium) 8.00pm - Break and break out 8.30pm - ITP @ Auditorium (OR) Windows 10 Game Development @ 22CF12 9.30pm - Either Go home or gather at Auditorium for closing Guest Speaker Uditha Bandara will be flying from Srilanka to Singapore to speak in this Meetup. He is the first Xbox MVP in South East Asia. About Speaker: Uditha Bandara is specializes in .NET Game development for Windows Phone, Xbox and PC. He was the South East Asia’s First XNA/DirectX MVP (Most Valuable Professional). He had delivered sessions at various events and conferences in Singapore, Hong Kong,Malaysia Sri Lanka and India. He has published several articles,books, tutorials, and game demos on his XNA Game Development Blog – http://uditha.wordpress.com
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Automatic differentiation in deep learning by @Shawn Tan
events.description: If you've come across the term deep learning before and have been hearing about how we're going to get Skynet soon, this talk will let you in on a little bit more of the details: The history of some of its development in the past and how it works. I will also delve a little into automatic differentiation, which has become increasingly useful given the more complicated models being built. Shawn is currently a research assistant in NUS with the speech recognition group. Previously, he worked as a data janitor for Semantics3. EDITOR's NOTE: Shawn Tan will possibly be one of the core contributors who will be responsible for ending human race and inciting the rise of the machines. Where are you, John Connor???

events.name: Haskell mentorship
events.description: We will go on With Learn You a Haskell, benefitting from Sönke's tutorial on algebraic datatypes from July 21st.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: Open House:  100th Year Anniversary of Datwyler & SG50
events.description: To celebrate Datwyler 100th Year Anniversary and SG50, we invite you to come to Datwyler Open House on Aug 6 at any time between 11am to 5pm. This is to be held on the eve of long SG national holiday from Aug 7-10. We will provide tour to its facility (office, demo room, warehouse, workshop). Datwyler is the Swiss manufacturer of structured cabling and elevator cabling. Singapore has been the logistics hub for Asia since 1996. Datwyler is among few reputable MNCs that have its own full-fledged operation to support customers. We handles orders, warehousing, delivery, customer services by ourselves. Each product that we ship out is 100% tested and not merely pass sampling test. Each local staff has been well-trained towards Swiss quality of product, innovation and customer services. The Open House is to give a rare opportunity for you to look & feel its facility. You may come anytime between 11am to 5pm on Thu, Aug 6, and spend whatever time you prefer. We invite you to join lunch or drinks together with us. Then we will give you a tour to our facility and demo room. If time is permitted for you, you could join some talks from us and our partners on data centre technologies, structured cabling, GPON, Wireless Access Point system, data centre physical security system, fire protection, and so on. For those tech entrepreneurs who like to seek business opportunities in data centre, structured cabling, wireless, networking, we will provide a talk on how we can provide resources and supports for you. You will receive a special edition of celebration gift from Datwtyler.
events.location: Datwyler, 30 Toh Guan Road #01-01A (Opp IMM, near Furniture Mall).  , Singapore

events.name: Aug/2015 - Open Space (Culture)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Rohit Arora from Barclays Open Space Theme: Culture Rohit: When you’re trying to introduce Agile Project Development into your company or to a new team, it’s important that you know how to make it work. More than the terms, practices, meetings and user stories, the Agile Mindset keeps the team on point and helps them self-manage even if they aren’t too familiar with the terms used in Agile. But what is a Mindset? Why is this more important than the terms and practices of Agile on the habitual and personal level? Essentially a mindset is a culture that you implement with the incentive to accept or adopt the cultural norms. If you want to truly implement Agile, it has to become a part of your company’s culture. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) . Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Someone from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he/she will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm There is no guarantee of trips after 7:45pm.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: UNited We Hack
events.description: Always wanted to put your mad coding skills to do some good? Women’s earnings are, on average, 24% lower than men’s in developed countries. The difference is even starker in developing economies. Be part of the movement as we gather brightest minds to use the latest APIs and create innovative solutions to empower women & improve gender equality! On August 15th and 16th, join us at Microsoft Singapore for a 24 hour hackathon to innovate in the field of women’s financial and economic empowerment. This hackathon is open to men and women who are interested in using the latest API’s to create cutting edge solutions around gender equity and financial equality. Tickets are FREE at http://unitedwehack.com/ Winning teams would not only receive cash prizes but also gain access to incubation & mentorship programmes, ensuring that your ideas are brought to the real world! Join us to be part of an amazing cause! Come even if you only want to look at the pretty judges.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Front End TL;DR August 2015
events.description: For the August meetup we will visit Wego, a travel search site headquartered in Singapore. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at Wego ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks 7:15pm — Intro talk by the host 7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned 9:30pm — The end. There will be guest wifi, food & drinks provided. Address: 100 Beach Road #23-07/13 Shaw Tower Singapore 189702 Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time.

events.name: August meetup
events.description: • "Exceptions...WTF?!" by Simon Hengel • 101 talk on "Polymorphic types" by Paul Meng • [Melvin's talk has been retracted.]

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: Ryoji Ikeda: Supercodex Thursday 20 August, 8pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 Tickets: $12/$10 (students). Purchase here: http://bit.ly/1HB0JQP Concept, composition: Ryoji Ikeda Computer graphics, programming: Tomonaga Tokuyama PREPARE TO BE IMMERSED IN A MULTI-SENSORIAL EXTRAVAGANZA. Sonic artist, visual artist, electronic composer and computer-musician in one, Ryoji Ikeda has gained international renown for his provocative work combining visuals and sound. ArtScience Museum is delighted to host the performance of Ikeda’s supercodex [live set], which reworks musical concepts from Ikeda’s 2013 superposition piece, which investigates how we understand the reality of nature on an atomic scale, taking its starting point in mathematical models and quantum mechanics. supercodex [live set] begins subtly, with digital noise, blips and bass drones, from which gradually emerges the core elements of techno and dance music, where Ikeda uses raw data and mathematical models to generate music and projections. Don’t miss this extraordinary live performance, where the accompanying visuals add to the rich textures to merge the senses, creating an unforgettable experience. For more information please visit: http://www.ryojiikeda.com/archive/concerts/#supercodex_live_set Part of the Soundislands Festival http://soundislands.com/si15/

events.name: Conversations: “~sound:senses”
events.description: “~sound:senses” Saturday 22nd August 2015 2.15pm to 5.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE What is the colour of sound? Does the shape of the plate change the taste of the cake? This August, join us as leading artists and scientists in the fields of psychology, sound art, perception, and multimodal design come together to explore how sound acts as the glue connecting our sensorial experiences and interactions. Guest speakers include luminaries such as interaction designer, Stefania Serafin, crossmodality researcher Charles Spence, composer Joyce Beetuan Koh, filmmaker Daniel Belton, and psycholinguist Suzy Styles. Chairing the panel is ArtScience Museum Executive Director, Honor Harger. Closing the event is Black Zenith, who will be performing Microsaccades; a culmination of sound, live visuals and video. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, initiated by PerMagnus Lindborg with support from CLASS and ADM at Nanyang Technological University, the Italian Institute of Culture, and the Arts Council of New Zealand.

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Sunday 23rd August 2015 10am to 6.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE “~sound:senses” Sound is the medium that acts as the glue between the senses, intertwining hearing, vision and movement. This Sunday Showcase, we invite you to dive into a coral reef of artworks and scientific demonstrations by international artists and researchers who have mapped out crossmodal associations with touch, smell, feel, and taste. “~sound:senses” will feature sound installations, experimental films, robotic sculptures, mobile media, web audio solutions, as well as workshops on electroacoustic sounds led by experts. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, with support from Nanyang Technological University.

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!

events.name: Papers We Love #012
events.description: Paper #1 - Worker/Wrapper/Makes It/Faster: Laurence Day : http://www.cs.nott.ac.uk/~jph/wwmf.pdf Paper #2 - Robust Range-Only Beacon Localization : Ashish Raste - https://people.csail.mit.edu/teller/pubs/robl.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: Gazelle Twin and Special Guests 10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 FREE This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents. Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin. Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”. Joining Gazelle Twin will be a carefully curated selection of audio visual and electronic artists from Singapore to present an evening of the most innovative and imaginative breaking sounds from the UK and Singapore underground. FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already. After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you. Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that. Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week! What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. ** DISCLAIMER **: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 13th Nov 2015 7:00pm
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room
